%% LyX 2.0.5.1 created this file.  For more info, see http://www.lyx.org/.
%% Do not edit unless you really know what you are doing.
\documentclass[english]{article}
\usepackage[pdftex]{eforms}
\usepackage{fullpage}

\newcommand{\textBox}[1]{
\textField[\Ff\FfMultiline]{#1}{\linewidth}{48bp}
}

\newcommand{\textLine}[1]{
\textField[]{#1}{\linewidth}{12bp}
}

\newcommand{\myRadio}[2]{
\radioButton{#1}{10bp}{10bp}{#2}
}

\newcommand{\rankChoice}[3]{
#2 -
1 \myRadio{#1}{1}
2 \myRadio{#1}{2}
3 \myRadio{#1}{3}
4 \myRadio{#1}{4}
5 \myRadio{#1}{5}
- #3
}

\newcommand{\likertScale}[1]{
Strongly Disagree \myRadio{#1}{StronglyDisagree}
Disagree \myRadio{#1}{Disagree}
Neutral \myRadio{#1}{Neutral}
Agree \myRadio{#1}{Agree}
Strongly Agree \myRadio{#1}{StronglyAgree}
}

\setlength{\parindent}{0cm}


\begin{document}

\section{Multiple Choice}

\begin{enumerate}
\item Overall reactions to the software. 

\rankChoice{overall wonderful}{Terrible}{Wonderful}

\rankChoice{overall difficult easy}{Difficult}{Easy}

\rankChoice{overall frustrating satisfying}{Frustrating}{Satisfying}

\rankChoice{overall inadequate adequate power}{Inadequate Power}{Adequate power}

\rankChoice{overall dull stimulating}{Dull}{Stimulating}

\rankChoice{overall rigid flexible}{Rigid}{Flexible}

\item The system was easy to use.

\likertScale{easy to use}

\item I liked the general look and feel of the system.

\likertScale{look and feel}

\item I enjoyed using the system?

\likertScale{enjoy to use}

\item I clearly understood the intended purpose of the system, and how to achieve those goals.

\likertScale{indended purpose}

\item I never experienced a time while using the system where I was unsure of what action to take next.

\likertScale{next action unsure}

\item The information presented was organized in a clear way.

\likertScale{information presented}

\item The sequence of screens presented to complete tasks were clear.

\likertScale{Sequence of Screens}

\item The position of messages on the screen was consistent.

\likertScale{Message position}

\item The input prompts were clear.
\likertScale{clear prompts}

\item The computer always informed you about its progress.

\likertScale{computer progress}

\item Error messages were helpful. 

\likertScale{error messages}

\item Learning to operate the system was easy.

\likertScale{learning to operate}

\item Exploring new features by trial and error was easy. 

\likertScale{explore by trial and error}

\item Remembering names and use of commands was easy.

\likertScale{remembering commands}

\item Performing tasks was always straightforward. 

\likertScale{performing tasks}

\item Help messages on the screen were helpful.

\likertScale{help messages}

\item Supplemental reference materials were clear.

\likertScale{reference materials}

\item I easily adapted to using the system.

\likertScale{easily adapted}

\end{enumerate}

\section{Open Ended Questions}

\begin{enumerate}

\item How many times did the system do something that surprised you, or that you didn't expect?

\textLine{system surprising}

\item Can you remember those times, if any existed?

\textBox{remember surprises}

\item Which tasks were easy to complete?

\textBox{Which tasks were easy to complete?}

\item Can you identify why the solutions were clear?

\textBox{Can you identify why the solutions were clear?}

\item Which tasks were difficult to complete?

\textBox{Which tasks were difficult to complete?}

\item How would you make those tasks easier to complete?

\textBox{How would you make those tasks easier to complete?}

\item Were there any instructions, vocabulary or labels that you found confusing?

\textBox{Were there any instructions, vocabulary or labels that you found confusing?}

\item Any general complaints or suggestions?

 \textBox{Any general complaints or suggestions?}

\end{enumerate}

\section{About You}

What is your highest level of education?

\textLine{education}

If you went to college, what was your major?

\textLine{major}

How comfortable do you feel while using a computer?

\rankChoice{computer literacy}{Uncomfortable}{Comfortable}

\hfill

Have you used a system that serves a similar purpose as this one before?

\textLine{similar systems}

How old are you? If you are uncomfortable answering exactly, feel free to round to a nearby age.

\textLine{age}

\end{document}
